VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: When the user attempts to authenticate using the service providers authentication prompt this error will raise if the provider cannot verify the client’s host/device due to encryption issues or a outdated web browser
The Web Authentication Prompt requires a “auth” parameter to verify the integrity of the request. This is provided by the Service Provider automatically when requesting authentication via COA
The Web Authentication Prompt requires a “application_id” parameter to verify the request authentication token.
The Web Authentication Prompt requires a “request_token” to verify the authentication request with the Application.

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: INVALID APPLICATION ID IN AUTH PROMPT
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The Web Authentication Prompt will fail if Application ID is invalid

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR IN AUTH PROMPT (TYPE PROMPT-01)
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: There was an internal server error regarding the Web Authentication Prompt, Type PROMPT-01 defines the type of  prompt that was being shown to the user for troubleshooting purposes

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: INVALID REQUEST TOKEN IN AUTH PROMPT
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: This error is raised when the Web Authentication Prompt cannot verify the request token and or is considered invalid

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: INTERNAL SERVER ERROR IN AUTH PROMPT (TYPE PROMPT-02)
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: There was an internal server error regarding the Web Authentication Prompt, Type PROMPT-02 defines the type of  prompt that was being shown to the user for troubleshooting purposes
The Web Authentication Prompt requires a “redirect” parameter for Applications requesting authentication using the redirect method
This error happens when an Application Authentication Type is not supported by the Authentication Prompt, see the documentation on how to use your Application’s authentication type
The Web Authentication Prompt will fail if the parameter ‘verification_token’ is missing, this is automatically provided by the Service Provider but will fail

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: CANNOT VERIFY REQUEST, INVALID VERIFICATION TOKEN
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The Web Authentication Prompt cannot verify the Verification Token and will not proceed due to security reasons, the user should attempt request authentication with the Application again.
This error raises when COASniffle fails to provide the required ‘field’ parameter.
This error raises when COASniffle fails to provide the required ‘value’ parameter.
This error raises when COASniffle fails to provide the required ‘first_name’ parameter.
This error is a error related to COASniffle’s internal Application Certificate used for Intellivoid’s builtin Applications
This error is a error related to COASniffle’s internal client responsible for communicating with Intellivoid’s internal services
Generic Access Denied error related to COASniffle’s internal server client
This error raises when COASniffle fails to provide the required ‘plan_name’ parameter, this is related to handling subscriptions
The service provider failed to find the subscription plan that COASniffle requested.
The service provider failed to find the subscription promotion code that COASniffle requested.
The service provider found the Subscription Plan COASniffle was requesting but is currently made unavailable by the Service Provider
The service provider found the Subscription Promotion COASniffle was requesting but is currently made unavailable by the Service Provider
The service provider reports that the subscription promotion code that COASniffle is requesting has expired and is no longer valid

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: SUBSCRIPTION PROMOTION NOT APPLICABLE TO PLAN
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: The Subscription Plan and Subscription Promotion that COASniffle provided is not valid because the promotion is not applicable to the subscription plan
The user attempted to make a purchase without the sufficient funds available in the user’s account.
This error raises when COASniffle fails to provide the required ‘subscription_id’ parameter.
This error raises when COASniffle fails to provide the required ‘application’ parameter.

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: DIRECT AUTHENTICATION IS ONLY APPLICABLE TO BULTIN APPLICATIONS
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: This error is raised when the client attempts to tell the Authentication Prompt to directly authenticate to the user, this is not allowed for security reasons and it’s only applicable to Intellivoid’s builtin applications such as Intellivoid Suite services

VARIABLES.MESSAGE: DIRECT AUTHENTICATION FAILED, APPLICATION NOT FOUND
VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: This error is raised when the Authentication Prompt can’t find the Application that’s trying to request direct authentication
